name: Cooperative Living Apartments
description: The cooperative living apartments (called the Co-ops) are apartments that are leased or owned by the agency and rented by four to five residents who share the responsibility for rent and utilities. Residents receive individual case management services and attend regular house meetings facilitated by a case manager to assist clients in the coordination of maintaining a communal household. Clients work closely with their case managers to determine the type and frequency of services they receive. B

howToGetIt: Residents must be referred into the cooperative living apartments by a service provider. For more information, call 415-861-0828 or email info@progressfoundation.org.
